# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the implementation of your request in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]" => "_")
end
```

You can use this function by calling it with a string representing the column name. For example, `clean_column("My Column")` will return `"my_column"`. This function first converts the input to lower case and strips any leading or trailing whitespaces using the `strip` function. Then it replaces all spaces and hyphens in the cleaned string with underscores using the `replace` function. The regular expression `r"[\s-]" => "_"` is used to match either a space or a hyphen and replace them with an underscore.
